snippet: Veterinary drugs commonly administered to horses would render their meat adulterated under New Mexico law, meaning it would not be fit for human consumption.
abstract: Ruling by New Mexico's attorney general that veterinary drugs commonly administered to horses would render their meat unfit for human consumption creates headache for Valley Meat Company, plant in Roswell, NM, that is on track to be first horse slaughtering facility to open in United States since 2007.
lead_paragraph: Veterinary drugs commonly administered to horses would render their meat adulterated under New Mexico law, meaning it would not be fit for human consumption.

headline.seo: Horse Meat Plant in New Mexico Faces Hurdle After Ruling on Drugs
headline.main: Plant Faces New Hurdle on Horse Meat
headline.print_headline: Plant Faces New Hurdle On Horse Meat
